challengeInfo.title: 30 Days React Hands-On Challenge
challengeInfo.shortDescription: A practical 30-day coding challenge to master React step-by-step.
challengeInfo.fullDescription: This 30-day React hands-on challenge is designed to help developers build core React skills by building one small project each day. From beginner-friendly tasks like form validation to advanced topics like drag-and-drop and API integration, each day targets a key concept. By the end of the challenge, you'll have 30 mini React projects and a stronger understanding of real-world application building.

days.title: React Components
days.shortDescription: Learn how to build and reuse components.
days.longDescription: Create your first React component and render it in the root App. Understand the structure of a React component, JSX, and how to export/import components between files.
days.tip: Start by thinking of each UI piece as a separate component.

days.title: React Props
days.shortDescription: Pass data between parent and child components.
days.longDescription: Create a parent component that sends data to its child component using props. Learn how data flows downward in React and how props make components dynamic.
learnPoints: Passing data from parent to child
days.tip: Think of props as 'arguments' for your components — they help keep your code flexible.

days.title: State Management
days.shortDescription: Handle dynamic data inside components.
days.longDescription: Use the useState hook to manage local component state. Update UI reactively when state changes and understand the difference between props and state.
days.tip: State allows React components to ‘remember’ things like user input or UI toggles.

days.title: React useEffect
days.shortDescription: Work with side effects like API calls.
days.longDescription: Learn how to use the useEffect hook for performing side effects such as fetching data, manipulating DOM, or setting timers in functional components.
days.tip: Always include dependencies in your useEffect to avoid infinite re-renders.

days.title: Conditional Rendering
days.shortDescription: Render components based on conditions.
days.longDescription: Learn how to render different UI elements conditionally using JavaScript expressions, ternary operators, and logical &&.
days.tip: When conditions get complex, use helper functions for readability.

days.title: Lists and Keys
days.shortDescription: Render multiple components using lists.
days.longDescription: Learn how to render dynamic lists using the JavaScript map() function and assign unique keys for better rendering performance.
days.tip: Always give each list item a stable and unique key to help React track changes efficiently.

days.title: React Forms
days.shortDescription: Handle user input and form submission.
days.longDescription: Learn how to manage controlled and uncontrolled components, handle input change events, and capture form data effectively.
days.tip: Keep input values in state for easy form control and validation.

days.title: React useRef Hook
days.shortDescription: Access DOM elements and persist mutable values.
days.longDescription: Understand how to use the useRef hook to directly access DOM elements and store mutable values that don’t trigger re-renders.
days.tip: Refs are useful when you need to directly manipulate a DOM element or store a value across renders.

days.title: React useContext Hook
days.shortDescription: Share data without prop drilling.
days.longDescription: Learn how to use React’s Context API with useContext to share state globally between components without manually passing props down the tree.
days.tip: Context works best for global state like themes, user info, or app settings.

days.title: React useReducer Hook
days.shortDescription: Manage complex state logic in React.
days.longDescription: Understand how to use the useReducer hook for managing more complex state transitions. Ideal for cases where multiple state updates depend on each other.
days.tip: When state logic grows complicated, useReducer brings clarity and structure.

days.title: React Conditional Rendering
days.shortDescription: Render UI based on conditions.
days.longDescription: Use conditional statements, logical operators, and ternary expressions to show or hide elements dynamically based on state or props.
days.tip: Use `&&` for simple conditionals and `? :` for multi-branch logic.

days.title: React useEffect Hook
days.shortDescription: Perform side effects in components.
days.longDescription: Learn to use the useEffect hook for running side effects such as data fetching, DOM manipulation, or event listeners.
days.tip: Remember to clean up effects like event listeners to prevent memory leaks.

days.title: React Custom Hooks
days.shortDescription: Create reusable logic with custom hooks.
days.longDescription: Extract repetitive stateful logic into custom hooks for reusability and cleaner components.
days.tip: Keep hooks pure and ensure they follow React’s rules of hooks.

days.title: React Routing Basics
days.shortDescription: Add navigation using React Router.
days.longDescription: Set up basic routing with react-router-dom. Create multiple pages and navigate using Link components.
days.tip: Always wrap your app in BrowserRouter for navigation to work.

days.title: Nested & Dynamic Routes
days.shortDescription: Handle complex routing structures.
days.longDescription: Learn how to create nested routes, route parameters, and dynamic paths for detailed views.
days.tip: Use `useNavigate` for programmatic routing transitions.

days.title: React useMemo Hook
days.shortDescription: Optimize expensive calculations.
days.longDescription: Learn how to memoize computationally heavy values using useMemo to improve performance.
days.tip: Only memoize when necessary — premature optimization can slow you down.

days.title: React useCallback Hook
days.shortDescription: Memoize callback functions.
days.longDescription: Understand how useCallback helps avoid unnecessary re-creations of functions and improves rendering efficiency.
days.tip: Combine useCallback with React.memo for maximum optimization.

days.title: React.memo for Components
days.shortDescription: Prevent unnecessary re-renders.
days.longDescription: Use React.memo to memoize functional components so they only re-render when props change.
days.tip: React.memo is great for pure components with stable props.

days.title: Lazy Loading & Suspense
days.shortDescription: Improve performance by loading components on demand.
days.longDescription: Implement lazy loading using React.lazy and Suspense to optimize bundle size and initial load speed.
days.tip: Wrap lazy components with Suspense to handle loading gracefully.

days.title: React Error Boundaries
days.shortDescription: Catch and handle UI errors gracefully.
days.longDescription: Build an ErrorBoundary component to catch runtime errors and show a fallback UI instead of crashing the app.
days.tip: Error Boundaries catch errors in the render tree but not in event handlers.

days.title: Controlled vs Uncontrolled Components
days.shortDescription: Learn how React manages form inputs differently.
days.longDescription: Understand the difference between controlled and uncontrolled components. Build a form using both approaches and compare how state is managed.
days.tip: Use controlled inputs for predictable and testable form behavior.

days.title: React Portals
days.shortDescription: Render components outside their parent hierarchy.
days.longDescription: Create modals and tooltips using React Portals to handle z-index and layout issues effectively.
days.tip: Portals don’t break the React event system — events still bubble through React’s hierarchy.

days.title: React Context API
days.shortDescription: Share data without prop drilling.
days.longDescription: Use the Context API to manage global state like theme or authentication. Create providers and consumers using useContext.
days.tip: For large apps, combine Context with useReducer for better structure.

days.title: React Performance Optimization
days.shortDescription: Make apps faster and smoother.
days.longDescription: Optimize performance using memoization, key management, lazy loading, and developer tools.
days.tip: Focus on meaningful optimizations — profile before you optimize.

days.title: React Testing with RTL
days.shortDescription: Write unit tests for components.
days.longDescription: Learn the basics of testing React components using React Testing Library and Jest.
days.tip: Write tests that mimic user behavior — not implementation details.

days.title: Redux Basics
days.shortDescription: Manage global state using Redux.
days.longDescription: Set up Redux in a React app. Create actions, reducers, and connect components using the store.
days.tip: Keep Redux state normalized — avoid deeply nested objects.

days.title: Redux Thunk for Async Actions
days.shortDescription: Handle async data flows in Redux.
days.longDescription: Use Redux Thunk middleware to handle async API calls and manage loading states effectively.
days.tip: Keep async logic inside Thunk functions — reducers should stay pure.

days.title: React Suspense for Data Fetching
days.shortDescription: Use Suspense for smoother data loading.
days.longDescription: Explore React Suspense for managing data fetching and fallback UIs seamlessly.
learnPoints: Suspense with lazy and data loading
days.tip: Suspense simplifies async UI — focus on loading states and transitions.

days.title: React Deployment
days.shortDescription: Deploy your React project to production.
days.longDescription: Learn to build and deploy your React app using Vercel, Netlify, or GitHub Pages. Optimize builds for performance.
days.tip: Always test your build locally before deploying to production.

days.title: Final Project & Wrap-Up
days.shortDescription: Combine everything you learned in one project.
days.longDescription: Build a small complete app (like a Todo or Weather App) using everything you've learned — hooks, routing, context, and deployment.
days.tip: Don’t aim for perfection — focus on connecting all pieces confidently.
